common.Calibrator.threshold_calibrator module¶

class common.Calibrator.threshold_calibrator.Calibrator[source]¶

Bases: object

Create an instance of douglas quaid for each algorithm and for each threshold : send provided pictures, get quality statistics compared with provided ground truth file and do it again. Outputs a fine tuned config file at the end.

algorithm_evaluator(folder_of_pictures: pathlib.Path, ground_truth_file: pathlib.Path, to_calibrate_algo: carlhauser_server.Configuration.algo_conf.Algo_conf, output_folder: pathlib.Path = None) → carlhauser_server.Configuration.algo_conf.Algo_conf[source]¶

generate_feature_conf(to_calibrate_algo: carlhauser_server.Configuration.algo_conf.Algo_conf) → carlhauser_server.Configuration.feature_extractor_conf.Default_feature_extractor_conf[source]¶
get_best_thresholds(image_folder: pathlib.Path, output_path: pathlib.Path, visjs_json_path: pathlib.Path, cal_conf: common.Calibrator.calibrator_conf.Default_calibrator_conf) -> (typing.List[common.PerformanceDatastructs.perf_datastruct.Perf], <class 'common.Calibrator.calibrator_conf.Default_calibrator_conf'>)[source]¶

Compute the best threshold to apply to distance to have an optimized number of False Positive, True Positive, etc. :param image_folder: The folder of picture to send and request, to optimize parameters for :param output_path: The output path where the graph and other data will be stored :param visjs_json_path: The “ground truth” file that serves as reference to optimize False Positive, etc. :param cal_conf: Values of False Positive, True Positive, etc. expected :return: List of performance values (threshold + False Positive, True Positive, etc. performances) and a modified cal_conf with “best threshold” regarding False Positive, True Positive, etc. target values
